answerText: identity matrix [or I] [10] Linearly independent systems of equations can be solved using matrices if the matrix is put in this form, where every leading coefficient is a one and is the only nonzero entry in its column.
heading: NASAT  |2014 | 15 | 1 | Science | Math | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Answer the following about matrices, for 10 points each.  [10] A square matrix with ones on the diagonal and zeros elsewhere is this special matrix, which is required to yield the same matrix by which it is multiplied.
